snippet: A $10 million American expedition is close to beginning work to drill through to a subglacial lake in Antarctica, looking for signs of microbial life and insight on glaciers.
abstract: American expedition is set to begin drilling in a subglacial lake in Antarctica, seeking evidence of life; project, one of three piloted by separate countries in region, may uncover long-hidden microbes that could provide clues about life elsewhere in solar system.
lead_paragraph: A $10 million American expedition is close to beginning work to drill through to a subglacial lake in Antarctica, looking for signs of microbial life and insight on glaciers.

headline.seo: Wissard Project Seeks Signs of Life Under Antarctica
headline.main: Deep Under Antarctica, Looking for Signs of Life
headline.print_headline: Deep Under Antarctica, Looking for Signs of Life

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Wissard (Whillans Ice Stream Subglacial Access Research Drilling)
